item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: It takes a lot of moving parts to get an IndieWeb site working. Omnibear offers logging to help you troubleshoot any issues when authenticating to your site or posting to your micropub endpoint. Enable logging Go to the settings page and check the box labeled “Record debug logs” to enable logging. Unchecking this box and saving settings will delete existing logs. “Info” and “warning” logs will not be saved while it is unchecked.

item.title: Features
item.description: Posting Omnibear is a MicroPub client, allowing you to publish posts to your website from anywhere on the web. Click on the browser extension icon to open the drafting window. Use this to compose and save your post. Replying You can also post a reply to anything on the web. Right-click and select “Reply to entry” to write a reply. This will reply to the current URL. If the current page is published with valid microformats, you can reply to any “h-entry” on the page.

item.title: Omnibear version 0.5.3
item.description: With this release, Omnibear works in Firefox. Unfortunately, there is still a little bit of cleanup to do in order to get it accepted into the Firefox Add-on store, but if you are comfortable doing a dev install on your own, you can give it a test run. Other changes: Fixes issues finding and highlighting the h-entry when right-clicked. Includes some permissions fixes to try to get Omnibear working in other browsers besides Chrome Also posted on IndieNews
